The last 24 hours were a harsh reminder of how fast sentiment can flip in crypto.

A surge in volatility triggered a $1.36B liquidation wave, wiping out 189,657 traders across the market. Long positions absorbed most of the damage, accounting for 91% ($1.24B) of total liquidations, while shorts lost $121M.

Bitcoin led the losses at $557M, followed by Ethereum ($326M) and XRP ($61M).
As leverage stacked up, price swings punished crowded positions.

In markets like this, survival comes down to risk management ‚Äî not predictions.

 $XRP #BingX

Over over 336,000 traders were liquidated in the last 24 hours and lost a cumulative total of about $1.36 billion.


$XRP getting caught in a $1.36B liquidation wave shows how fast sentiment flips when leverage stacks up, even on names people feel ‚Äúsafe‚Äù holding. With 91% of the damage coming from longs, this wasn‚Äôt bad news, it was crowded positioning meeting volatility.

While dismissing the global reset narrative, WrathofKahneman said the only factor that truly matters for XRP is growing daily usefulness. His view reflects a broader community stance that sees the global reset narrative as a distraction from the fundamentals that shape XRP‚Äôs value proposition.     According to this perspective, XRP does not require a sudden systemic shift to succeed. Rather, its relevance will grow organically as real-world adoption expands. As transaction volumes, integrations, and practical applications increase, measurable data will ultimately validate its importance.      According to WrathofKahneman, the numbers that companies cannot ignore refer specifically to sustained growth in daily XRP transaction volume and liquidity. Therefore, he says he anticipates a point at which XRP scales sufficiently to make it economically impractical for firms to ignore its use.     Although XRP has not yet reached the expected scale, it continues to process billions of dollars in daily transactions.
